Summary: Stiles never meant to use his binoculars for anything but the force of good, but that’s probably how a lot of villains start out. The road to Hell and all that. entry.title: The Loquacious Fingers
entry.summary:
Author: brsfic

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 47,524Chapters: 11/11Kudos: 228

Summary: Derek Hale didn’t expect getting lost in his own neighborhood to change anything—until the night he frightened a stranger in a dark alley without meaning to. Stiles Stilinski is deaf, skittish, stubborn, all sharp eyes and quiet panic, a notebook clutched to his chest, and a silence Derek doesn’t understand until much later. Soon Stiles is stepping into Derek’s messy loft, borrowing his books, drinking his tea, and filling Derek’s quiet spaces with the warm, steady presence Derek didn’t know he needed. Things begin to get tricky when Derek realizes that his erotic stories more and more star Stiles instead of the usual sexy female heroine. But everything's under control until one day, Stiles is curled on Derek’s couch reading the manuscript he never intended anyone to see. Derek isn’t sure what terrifies him more: getting lost in the dark with no one to help him or Stiles recognizing the pieces of himself hidden in the pages.

entry.title: Road Trip
entry.summary:
Author: brsfic

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,595Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 12

Summary: "Just get a ride home with Derek." First of all, how dare his dad! Because Stiles had reminded his dad—multiple times—to book the damn flight before prices went up, but Sheriff Stilinski forgot, and now Stiles is trapped in Derek Hale’s self-modified, apocalypse-ready Toyota FJ Cruiser for a twelve-hour drive home in a snowstorm with nothing but mutual hatred and unresolved teenage grudges for company. What starts as a petty road trip filled with aggressive silence, judgmental snack commentary, territorial road navigation, and one deeply inconvenient bathroom emergency slowly tightens into something unbearably tense, something electric. It's the kind of disaster that feels inevitable, the kind where you know things are going to go wrong. And oh—they go very, very wrong.

entry.title: Danger Nights
entry.summary:
Author: lanoirpapillon

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,403Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 4

Summary: A cup being placed beside his hand startled him, and he glanced up at the pepper-haired man with a badge touting the fact that he was part of the police. Derek stiffened, his hand curling around his own mug to keep himself from showing any outward signs of distress. What the fuck did Jackson do?“You’re Derek Hale, right?” Derek inclined his head in response, and he resisted the urge to bare his teeth as the policeman took a seat across from him. The man held up his hands, a smirk playing across his lips as he took a sip from his own to-go cup.“Just checking to see how Jackson is doing; I heard he wasn’t feeling well. And to pass on a message,” He dug around in his coat, withdrawing an envelope with a wax seal.“Jackson is doing fine…a message?” Derek flexed his fingers, wanting to grab the note and tear into it, to figure out why the government was getting in contact with him, the seal boasting the Royal Coat of Arms making his stomach drop.“Yes, it is to my understanding that your petition for permanent residence in the city has been accepted, congratulations.”---AKA the one where Jackson, Derek, and Stiles are (not so) accidentally absorbed into John Watson's pack.
